Description: THE PROJECT PROVIDES TRANSIENT BOATERS TRAVELING THE INTERCOASTAL WATERWAY (ICW) AND BOATERS ENJOYING THE UPPER PUNGO RIVER IN NORTH CAROLINA WITH ACCESS TO FACILITES AND SERVICES AVAILABLE AT THE DOWRY CREEK MARINA, SALTY CRAB RESTAURANT AND GREATER BELHAVEN AREA. IT ALSO PROVIDES SHORELINE PROTECTION IN FRONT OF THE MARINA AND ADDITIONAL RESTROOM AND SHOWER FACILITIES FOR OVERNIGHT TRANSIENT TRAFFIC. THERE ARE THREE MAIN PROJECT ACTIVITIES: CONSTRUCT TRANSIENT DAY DOCK TO PROVIDE MARINA FACILITY ACCESS  INSTALL 90  OF LIVING SHORELINE EROSION PROTECTION DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF THE MARINA  AND PROVIDE A HANDICAP RAMP WITH ADDITIONAL ELEVATED TRANSIENT BOATER SHOWERS AND RESTROOMS.DOWRY CREEK MARINA HAS INVESTED A GREAT DEAL TO PROVIDE A MODERN, ONE-STOP DESTINATION MARINA ON THE ICW FOR TRANSIENT BOATS. THE DAY DOCK AND HANDICAP RAMP WILL PROVIDE ACCESS TO ALL OF THE FACILITIES AND ALLOW THE MARINA TO TAKE CARE OF HUNDREDS OF PASSING TRANSIENT BOATS. THE EXTRA RESTROOMS AND SHOWERS WILL ENSURE THEY CAN CONTINUE TO PROVIDE HIGH LEVEL OF SERVICE TO THEIR CUSTOMERS AND THE LIVING SHORELINE WILL PROTECT THE AREA IN FRONT OF THE MARINA FROM INCREASED EROSION.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO HELP FUND BOATING IMPROVEMENTS AT APACHE LAKE AND LAKE MEAD. THE PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A WAVE ATTENUATOR WHICH WILL PROTECT INFRASTRUCTURECONSTRUCTED IN THE MARINA INCLUDING THE FUEL PUMPS AND TRANSIENT SLIPS CONSTRUCTED UNDER A PRIOR BIG GRANT. TEMPLE BARE MARINA ON LAKE MEAD WILL PERFORM MAINTENANCE TO THE EXISTING FUEL SYSTEM . THE MARINA WILL EXTEND THE EXISTING UTILITY LINES SERVICING THE FUEL PUMPS AS THE WATER LEVEL CONTINUES TO LOWER. THESE IMPROVEMENTS ARE INTENDED TO BE UTILIZED BY VESSELS 26 FEET AND LONGER. AN INCREASE IN LARGER VESSEL BOAT USE DAYS WILL BE REALIZED WITH THESE IMPROVEMENTS.

OVERVIEW: BASED ON INCREASED DEMAND AND A MARKET STUDY, SOUTH BAY MARINA WILL ADD 52 NEW DEDICATED TRANSIENT SLIPS TO THEIR EXISTING MARINA. BREAKWATER IMPROVEMENTS AND RESTROOM FACILITIES WILL BE NEEDED TO SUPPORT AND PROTECT THE ADDITIONAL SLIPS.BUDGET:  1,215,533 FEDERAL SHARE   598,696 LOCAL MATCHACTION AREA: THIS GRANT WILL TAKE PLACE IN THE CITY OF GREEN BAY, AT THE MOUTH OF THE FOX RIVER AND THE WATERS OF GREEN BAY (LAKE MICHIGAN).OUTCOME: THE PROJECT WILL ADD DEDICATED TRANSIENT SLIPS TO AN AREA OF THE STATE WHERE THE EXISTING CURRENT OPPORTUNITIES FALL WELL SHORT OF MEETING THE INCREASING DEMAND. THE GREEN BAY AREA OFFERS A LARGE VARIETY OF RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES THAT ATTRACT TRANSIENT BOATERS AND BENEFIT THE LOCAL ECONOMY.

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE SUBRECIPIENT, CAMERON COUNTY, FOR THE PLANNING, ANALYSIS, AND REGULATORY COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS ASSOCIATED WITH CONSTRUCTION OF FLEXIBLE BROADSIDE TRANSIENT MOORING FOR VESSELS 26 FT. AND LONGER AT SEA RANCH MARINA, 33256 STATE PARK RD 100, SOUTH PADRE ISLAND, CAMERON COUNTY, TEXAS. SEA RANCH MARINA IS ADJACENT TO DEEP WATER ACCESS TO THE GULF OF MEXICO AND WILL PROVIDE THE ONLY DEDICATED TRANSIENT MOORING IN CAMERON COUNTY. THE PROPOSED TRANSIENT FACILITIES WILL BE 100  DEDICATED TO PUBLIC TRANSIENT USE.
SUGARLOAF HARBOR MARINA, ARKANSAS IS REQUESTING BIG GRANT FUNDS TO REPLACE THE AGING FUEL SYSTEM AND ADD 15 TRANSIENT DOCKS TO THE MARINA TO MAKE THE AREA SAFER AND MORE ACCESSIBLE TO THE PUBLIC.

THE ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (ADEM) SEEKS FUNDING TO ADMINISTER THE BOATING INFRASTRUCTURE GRANT (BIG) PROGRAM IN ALABAMA. CURRENTLY, ADEM MANAGES FIFTEEN (15) PROJECTS, PAST AND PRESENT.THE ADEM PROPOSES TO CONTINUE ALL ASPECTS OF THE BIG PROGRAM IN ALABAMA INCLUDING MANAGING PAST, CURRENT, AND FUTURE BIG PROJECTS, PROVIDING GRANT PERFORMANCE AND ACCOMPLISHMENTS UPDATES, PROVIDING MONITORING EFFORTS TO ENSURE BIG-FUNDED FACILITIES ARE WELL CONSTRUCTED, MEET PROJECT OBJECTIVES, AND SERVE THE INTENDED PURPOSE FOR THEIR USEFUL LIFE, AND IDENTIFYING AND FOSTERING POTENTIAL FUTURE ALABAMA BIG PROJECTS, FROM INCEPTION TO COMPLETION. ADEM HAS NOT RECEIVED ANY FUNDS FOR MANAGING BIG FOR SEVERAL YEARS. ALL THE MONEY WAS USED BY THE GRANT SUB RECIPIENTS. ADEM HAS PROVIDED THE FUNDING TO ADMINISTER THE BIG PROGRAM.PROVIDING DEDICATED, DIRECT ADMINISTRATION OF THE BIG PROGRAM IN ALABAMA WILL ALLOW THE PROGRAM TO CONFIDENTLY MONITOR PAST PROJECTS FOR COMPLIANCE, ASSIST CURRENT BIG PROJECTS THROUGH THE CONSTRUCTION AND IMPLEMENTATION STAGES, AND RECRUIT POTENTIAL BIG PROJECTS IN THE STATE OF ALABAMA, RESULTING IN A INCREASE IN TIE-UP FACILITIES FOR TRANSIENT BOATERS IN ALABAMA.
THIS PROJECT WILL REMOVE AND REPLACE EXISTING ELECTRICAL COMPONENTS AT DETOUR STATE HARBOR TO PROVIDE IMPROVED SAFETY AND RELIABLE ELECTRICAL SERVICE FOR TRANSIENT BOATERS.

THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS TO REPLACE, MODERNIZE AND EXPAND THE ON-SITE TRANSIENT DOCKAGE SPACE AT FOUR FISH MARINA, FLORIDA, TO HELP SATISFY INCREASING DEMAND FOR HIGH QUALITY TRANSIENT DOCKAGE WHERE NO DEDICATED DOCKAGE EXISTS CURRENTLY. THE GRANT FUNDED PORTION OF THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE ACCESS TO AMENITIES FOR ELIGIBLE BOATERS BY CONSTRUCTING HEAVY DUTY CONCRETE FLOATING DOCKS, UTILITIES INCLUDING ELECTRICITY AND POTABLE WATER, FIRE STANDPIPES, WI-FI, AND TRANSIENT USE ONLY SHOWER CABANAS.

GRANT TO CONSTRUCT 123 DEDICATED TRANSIENT RECREATIONAL VESSEL SLIPS FOR VESSELS 26  OR LONGER, WITH AMENITIES AND UTILITIES SUCH AS WI-FI, ELECTRICITY, POTABLE WATER, A DEDICATED TRANSIENT RESTROOM, AND FUEL PIER IN FLORIDA.

THIS PROJECT IS TO CONSTRUCT A NEW 220-FT. FLOATING CONCRETE DOCK AT THE MOUTH OF BOOT KEY HARBOR, LOCATED AT THE SOUTHERN END OF MARATHON IN THE MIDDLE FLORIDA KEYS. THIS WILL CREATE 6 NEW DEDICATED TRANSIENT BERTHING SPACES FOR VESSELS UP TO 70-FT. IN LENGTH. ADDITIONALLY, SUBRECIPIENT WILL CONSTRUCT A 60-FT. LONG FLOATING FINGER PIER, TO PROVIDE OVERNIGHT DOCKAGE SPACE FOR 2 ADDITIONAL TRANSIENT VESSELS, AS WELL AS A TRANSIENT AMENITY PLATFORM TO ENHANCE THE TRANSIENT BOATING EXPERIENCE AT THE SITE. THE EXTENSION OF DOCK TREE  A  WILL ADD 5 MORE TRANSIENT SLIPS FOR A TOTAL OF 13 NEW DEDICATED SLIPS, ALL WITH UTILITIES, FIRE SUPPRESSION AND UPGRADES TO THE FUEL SYSTEM.

PROJECT ABSTRACT: MARINE-RELATED INDUSTRY AFFECTS EVERY ASPECT OF LIFE IN THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS (USVI). APPROXIMATELY 4,000 BOATS ARE REGISTERED IN THE USVI, WHICH 94  ARE RECREATIONAL. THE BOATING INFRASTRUCTURE GRANT TO THE USVI WILL ALLOW PLANNING AND MAINTENANCE FOR OVER 604 SQUARE MILES REPRESENTING OVER 80  OF THE JURISDICTION OF THE USVI. THE STRATEGIC MARINE CONSERVATION PLAN IN THIS GRANT WILL DETERMINE WHERE BIG ELIGIBLE ACTIVITIES ARE TAKING PLACE AND AREAS IN NEED OF BOATING INFRASTRUCTURE.

BLUE MOON PROPERTIES IS RESPECTFULLY REQUESTING FUNDING THROUGH THE BOATING INFRASTRUCTURE GRANT (BIG) TO BUILD A TRANSIENT RESTROOM FACILITY WITH A TRANSIENT BOAT PIER FOR THE LARGE BOATS FOR ACCESS TO THE RESTROOMS. THE ROSS BARNETT RESERVOIR, MISSISSIPPI, IS OVER 33,000 ACRES WITH AN ESTIMATED 30,000 BOATERS. THERE ARE NO TRANSIENT RESTROOMS LOCATED ON THE WATER ACCESSIBLE BY BOAT. THERE ARE PUBLIC RESTROOMS LOCATED AT THE MAJOR BOAT LAUNCH RAMPS AND PARKS BUT THERE ARE NO PIER DOCK SPACES AVAILABLE FOR TRANSIENT BOATERS TO ACCESS FOR RESTROOMS. CURRENTLY, LARGE BOATS WILL TIE UP THE BOAT LAUNCH PIERS DOCKS TO USE THE RESTROOMS WHICH CREATE PROBLEMS FOR BOATERS TRYING TO LAUNCH. SOME BOATERS WILL COME TO THE LOCAL FUEL DOCK AND RESTAURANT AT HARBOR STATION ONLY FOR THE PURPOSE TO USE RESTROOMS WHICH INTERRUPTS OR PREVENTS FUELING AND REDUCES NUMBER OF CUSTOMERS WHO CAN DOCK TO EAT AT THE RESTAURANT DUE TO THE 70-FOOT HOUSEBOATS AND LARGE CRUISERS USING UP MOST OF THE EXISTING PIER SPACE. TRANSIENT BOATERS WHO CANNOT ACCESS A RESTROOM FACILITY WITH EASE ARE KNOWN TO SIMPLY USE THE RESERVOIR WHICH DEGRADES THE WATER QUALITY AND RISKS BOTH THE HABITAT AND HUMAN HEALTH. THIS RESTROOM PROJECT WILL ALSO ENSURE A SAFE ENVIRONMENT FOR SWIMMERS AND WILDLIFE, FREE FROM SEWAGE DISCHARGE AND POTENTIAL DISEASE. PROVIDING EASY ACCESS TO RESTROOM FACILITIES WILL GO A LONG WAY TO HELP MAINTAIN A HIGH STANDARD OF WATER QUALITY.

THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO SUPPORT STAFF SALARIES AND ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES FOR INDIVIDUALS WITHIN THE GEORGIA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES  COASTAL RESOURCES DIVISION (CRD) WHO ADMINISTER AND SUPPORT THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE DIVISION S BOATING INFRASTRUCTURE GRANT PROGRAM. COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS GRANT INCLUDE PORTIONS OF THE ANNUAL SALARY FOR CRD S FEDERAL AID COORDINATOR, BOATING INFRASTRUCTURE GRANT COORDINATOR FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION, FISHERIES SECTION CHIEF FOR OVERSIGHT, AND FEDERAL AID COORDINATOR FOR SUPPORT. TRAVEL EXPENSES HAVE ALSO BEEN INCLUDED IN THE GRANT REQUEST.

THE WI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL ADDRESS AN ONGOING SEDIMENTATION ISSUE IN THE HIGH CLIFF STATE PARK MARINA. THE HIGHCLIFF MARINA SITS ON THE NORTHEAST SHORE OF LAKE WINNEBAGO IN SHERWOOD, WI, AND SERVES TRANSIENT BOATERS IN NON-TRAILERABLE VESSELS,PRIMARILY SAILBOATS. THE MARINA HAS DOCKING SPACE FOR  100 VESSELS (DEPENDING ON LENGTH). WITH 137,700 ACRES OF OPEN WATEREXTENDING 28 MILES LONG AND 10 MILES WIDE, LAKE WINNEBAGO IS THE SECOND-LARGEST NATURAL FRESHWATER LAKE IN THE UNITED STATES. THEHIGH CLIFF MARINA IS AN EXCEPTIONALLY POPULAR LOCATION FOR FAIR-WEATHER BOATING AND A HARBOR OF REFUGE DURING TIMES OF INCLEMENTWEATHER. AN EXISTING CULVERT APPROX. 120  LONG AND 12  IN DIAMETER DELIVERS RUNOFF FROM BUTTERFLY POND (UPLAND AREAS OF THE HIGH CLIFFPROPERTY) INTO THE MARINA BOAT BASIN. UPON INSPECTION, WDNR IDENTIFIED HOLES IN THE BOTTOM OF THE CULVERT ALLOW WATER TO RUN UNDERTHE CULVERT, WHICH MOBILIZES SEDIMENT THAT RUNS INTO THE BOAT BASIN. THIS SEDIMENTATION DECREASES THE DRAFT DEPTH OF THE MARINA,NEGATIVELY IMPACTS BOATER ENJOYMENT DUE TO DECREASED WATER CLARITY, AND IMPEDES NAVIGATION. WITH BIG TIER 1 FUNDS, WI DNR WILLEXCAVATE AND REPLACE THE EXISTING CULVERT.THIS PROJECT SCOPE INCLUDES: REPLACEMENT OF A FAILED CULVERT (ENGINEERING   CONSTRUCTION) REPLACEMENT OF EXISTING MARINA LIGHTS AND CHANNEL MARKERS. BIG PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION

THE SCDNR PROPOSES TO CONTINUE ALL ASPECTS OF THE BIG PROGRAM IN SC INCLUDING MANAGING PAST, CURRENT, AND FUTURE BIG PROJECTS, PROVIDING GRANT PERFORMANCE AND ACCOMPLISHMENTS UPDATES, PROVIDING MONITORING EFFORTS TO ENSURE BIG-FUNDED FACILITIES ARE WELL CONSTRUCTED, MEET PROJECT OBJECTIVES, AND SERVE THE INTENDED PURPOSE FOR THEIR USEFUL LIFE, AND IDENTIFYING AND FOSTERING POTENTIAL FUTURE SC BIG PROJECTS, FROM INCEPTION TO COMPLETION.

SAVANNAH MARINA IS A NEW-BUILD FACILITY THAT WILL BE USING BOATING INFRASTRUCTURE GRANT (BIG) FUNDS TO SUPPORT A PORTION OF ITS DEVELOPMENT. BIG FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT HALF OF THE APPROXIMATELY 2,590 LINEAR-FEET OF SIDE-TIE DOCKAGE, INTENDED TO BE USED FOR TRANSIENT VESSELS. OTHER PROJECT OBJECTIVES INCLUDE FUNDING FOR PEDESTALS, UTILITIES, AND ENGINEERING DESIGN.
ADELAIDE POINTE MARINA
ASHTABULA YACHT CLUB

DEMAND FOR TRANSIENT BOAT DOCKAGE AND AMENITIES IS INCREASING AT TRUMAN RESERVOIR IN SOUTHWESTERN MISSOURI, AND EXISTING DOCKAGE AT THE TRUMAN STATE PARK MARINA IS INSUFFICIENT TO MEET DEMAND. TRANSIENT (NIGHTLY RENTAL) SLIP OCCUPANCY AT THE MARINA GENERALLY RUNS 90 -100  THROUGHOUT THE TRADITIONAL BOATING SEASON AND REACHES HIGHEST OCCUPANCY ON THE WEEKENDS AND HOLIDAYS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER AND QUALITY OF TRANSIENT BOATING FACILITIES ON TRUMAN RESERVOIR.THE PROJECT WILL INVOLVE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW TRANSIENT DOCK TO ACCOMODATE BOATS AT LEAST 26  IN LENGTH. THE MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF CONSERVATION WILL PARTNER WITH GLADSON AND ASSOCIATES, LLC DOING BUSINESS AS TRUMAN STATE PARK MARINA TO CONSTRUCT THE NEW DOCK. THE NEW TRANSIENT DOCK AT THE MARINA WILL BE A 22-SLIP DOCK AND WILL BE OWNED AND MANAGED BY THE MARINA. NEW 200-AMP SERVICE WILL BE RUN OUT TO THE DOCK, WITH A 120-VOLT POWER PLUG AT EACH SLIP AND ACCESS TO WATER ALONG THE DOCK. A NEW 60  HANDRAIL WILL BE INSTALLED ALONG THE NEW WALKWAY ALONG THE HEAD OF THE DOCK. THE PROJECT WILL ADHERE TO AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT STANDARDS, AND THE FIRST TWO SLIPS IN THE TRANSIENT DOCK WILL BE HANDICAPPED ACCESSIBLE.THE MARINA FACILITIES WILL BE MOST HEAVILY UTILIZED DURING THE PEAK BOATING SEASON OF MAY-SEPTEMBER. THE PROJECT WILL BETTER ACCOMMODATE THE GROWING BOATING COMMUNITY, PROVIDE IMPROVED PUBLIC WATERFRONT ACCESS, AND GENERATE LOCAL TOURISM. CONSTRUCTION OF THE FACILITIES IS PLANNED FOR FALL 2023, AND THE PROJECT WILL BE COMPLETED BY JUNE 30, 2024.
FUNDS UNDER THIS GRANT AWARD WILL BE USED TO EXPAND THE TRANSIENT BOATER INFRASTRUCTURE AT SCUPPERNOG RIVER PARK, INCLUDING EXPANDING THE PIER PLATFORM AND ADDING FOUR MOORING DOLPHINS.
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AWARD IS TO EXPAND THE TRANSIENT BOATER INFRASTRUCTURE AT LADY S ISLAND MARINA TO INCLUDE ADDITIONAL TRANSIENT WET SLIPS, UTILITIES, A GANGWAY, AND A LIVING SHORELINE.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AWARD IS TO EXPAND THE TRANSIENT VESSEL INFRASTRUCTURE AT ST. JOHN S YACHT HARBOR TO INCLUDE 53 DEDICATED TRANSIENT WET SLIPS, 325 LF OF FLEXIBLE SIDE TIE BERTHING, UTILITIES, AND A GANGWAY.

THIS PROJECT INCLUDES THE CONSTRUCTION OF 66 TRANSIENT BOAT SLIPS OUT OF A TOTAL OF 271 SLIPS, A SERVICE DOCK  FUEL AND PUMP-OUT STATION , AND WAVE ATTENUATOR.THE COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN THE REDEVELOPMENT OF A HIGHLY DESIRABLE TRANSIENT BOATING FACILITY WHICH WILL INCLUDE A PROTECTED MAN-MADE HARBOR, ADA COMPLIANT SANITARY FACILITIES, AND EASY AND SAFE ACCESS TO FUEL. THE REFURBISHED OLD POINT COMFORT MARINA WILL PROVIDE ACCESSIBILITY FOR LARGE TRANSIENT BOATS AND PROVIDE REASONABLE AND CONVENIENT ACCESS TO NAVIGABLE WATERS. THE FACILITY WILL BE PROPERLY CONSTRUCTED AND OFFER NEEDED SERVICES SUCH AS FUEL, WATER, ELECTRIC UTILITIES  30 50 100 AMP SERVICE , RESTROOMS AND A BOATERS  LOUNGE.THE SUBRECIPIENT IS PACK BROTHERS HOSPITALITY.

THE TREASURE ISLAND ENTERPRISES BIG TIER II GRANT WILL CONSTRUCT A 718 FOOT LONG TRANSIENT DOCK IN CLIPPER COVE AS THE FIRST PHASE OF A LARGER PROJECT TO CONSTRUCT CLIPPER COVE MARINA WHICH WILL ACCOMMODATE UP TO 400 VESSELS  THE TRANSIENT DOCK WILL FEATURE TIE UPS FOR APPROXIMATELY 44 BIG ELIGIBLE VESSELS  THE TRANSIENT DOCK WILL FEATURE A VACUUM SEWAGE SYSTEM, POTABLE WATER, POWER, FIRE SUPPRESSION, AND ACCESS TO THE LANDSIDE FACILITIES FOR TRANSIENT BOATERS  THIS FACILITY WILL EXPAND CONVENIENT AND SAFE ACCESS FOR TRANSIENT RECREATIONAL BOATERS TO TREASURE ISLAND AND THE GREATER SAN FRANCISCO AREA  THESE DESTINATIONS OFFER VISITORS A WEALTH OF HISTORICAL, CULTURAL, NATURAL, SCENIC, AND TRADITIONAL TOURIST ATTRACTIONS  LETTERS OF SUPPORT WERE PROVIDED BY TREASURE ISLAND SAILING CLUB, BELLPORT GROUP, DUTRA, AND ANCHOR QEA

NJDOT WILL SUB GRANT FUNDS FROM THE BIG PROGRAM TO LINCOLN HARBOR ENTERPRISES, LLC   LHE   FOR A TIER II BOATING INFRASTRUCTURE GRANT   BIG   FOR THE REDEVELOPMENT OF LINCOLN HARBOR YACHT CLUB   LHYC    LHE SEEKS TO REDEVELOP THE EXISTING MARINA TO IMPROVE TRANSIENT ACCESS, CAPACITY, AND USE OF THE FACILITY  LHYC IS LOCATED ON THE HUDSON RIVER AT 1500 HARBOR BOULEVARD IN WEEHAWKEN, NEW JERSEY  LHYC SEEKS TO PROVIDE 111 NEW TRANSIENT ACCESS SLIPS FOR UNTRAILERABLE RECREATIONAL VESSELS 26  OR GREATER IN LENGTH

THE MARINE SERVICES BUREAU IS DEDICATED TO ADMINISTERING THE THE BIG PROGRAM TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE PROGRAM PURPOSE   ADMINISTRATION, COORDINATION, MONITORING AND ENFORCEMENT OF GRANT PROGRAM   ONGOING DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF PROCEDURES, STANDARDIZED APPLICATION AND GUIDELINES FOR ALL BIG PROGRAM APPLICANTS AND SUB AWARDEES APPROACH   CONTINUED TRAINING AND EDUCATION OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS PERTAINING TO BIG   INSPECTIONS OF PAST AND PRESENT BIG FACILITIES FOR COMPLIANCE   IMPROVED PROCEDURES FOR PROJECT OVERSIGHT AND MANAGEMENT   ONGOING ADDITIONS AND CHANGES TO NEWLY DEVELOPED ACCESS DATABASE EXPECTED RESULTS BENEFITS FUNDS RECEIVED THROUGH THE 2022 BIG ADMINISTRATIVE GRANT REQUEST WILL HELP NYS PARKS CONTINUE TO FACILITATE THE PERSONAL SERVICES NECESSARY TO ADMINISTER THE PROGRAM, AS WELL AS FUND ANY NECESSARY SITE VISITS AND POSSIBLE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES  THESE ADMINISTRATIVE DUTIES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO   DATABASE MAINTENANCE,  ONGOING OVERSIGHT OF BIG AWARD SUB RECIPIENTS,  CONTINUED COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL GRANT FUND DISBURSEMENTS,  UPDATES TO APPLICATION AND GUIDANCE DOCUMENTS, AS NECESSARY,  CONTINUED EFFORTS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL TRAINING TO OTHER STAFF, AS AVAILABLE

THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS TO MEET THE IMMEDIATE AND PROJECTED DEMAND FOR TRANSIENT SLIPS ON THE UPPER WANDO RIVER  THE PROPOSED SLIPS WILL PROVIDE A CURRENTLY UNAVAILABLE OPPORTUNITY FOR THE INCREASING NUMBER OF BOATERS VISITING THE CHARLESTON AREA TO EXPLORE AND STAY IN THE BEAUTIFUL UPPER WANDO RIVER AREA  WITHOUT THE PROJECT, THERE WILL BE NO DEDICATED TRANSIENT SLIPS IN THE AREA, WITH THE CLOSEST APPROXIMATELY TEN  10  MILES AWAY IN THE CHARLESTON HARBOR  CONTRACTORS UNKNOWN AT TIME OF AWARD

THE VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH THROUGH THE SUB GRANTEE, THE DOWNTOWN HAMPTON DEVELOPMENT PARTNERSHIP  DHDP  AND THE CITY OF HAMPTON, PROPOSES TO RENOVATE THE EXISTING TRANSIENT FLOATING SLIPS, UPGRADE BOATER FACILITIES, RENOVATIONS TO THE FIXED, AND EXISTING BULKHEADS  THE DOCKS AT DOWNTOWN HAMPTON CONSIST OF 32 SLIPS AND DESIGNED TO ACCOMMODATE VESSELS  26  IN LENGTH  THIRTY ONE OF THE 32 SLIPS ARE DESIGNATED FOR TRANSIENT VESSELS  THE DOCKS AT DOWNTOWN HAMPTON DHDP AND THE CITY OF HAMPTON WILL PROVIDE MATCHING FUNDS FOR THE RENOVATION PROJECT, PROJECT OVERSIGHT, AND WILL MANAGE THE MARINA AT THE COMPLETION OF THE PROJECT  THE PROJECT WILL FULFILL A NEED FOR TRANSIENT DOCKING FACILITIES IN THE AREA AND PROVIDE BENEFITS TO TRANSIENT BOATERS

THERE IS A NEED TO REPAIR THE BULKHEAD TO WHICH LARGER TRANSIENT VESSELS DOCK AND ALL TRANSIENT VESSELS FUEL  THERE IS ALSO A NEED FOR ENHANCED ADVERTISING TO MAKE TRANSIENT BOATERS AWARE OF THE ONANCOCK WHARF AND  MARINA AND ATTRACT THEM TO VISIT  THE WESTWARD FACING BULKHEAD AND FUEL DOCK HAS REACHED THE END OF ITS USEFUL LIFE AND NEED TO BE REPLACED  NEARLY 300 LINEAR FEET OF BULKHEAD FACES CHANNEL WARD, SERVING OUR FUEL DOCK AND OUR BULKHEAD SLIP USED FOR LARGER TRANSIENT VESSELS  NEW PILINGS WITH RUBBER GUARDS WILL PROTECT THE INTEGRITY OF TRANSIENT VESSELS TIED UP NEXT TO THE BULKHEAD

THE PORT OF BANDON IS REPLACING AND RECONFIGURING THEIR MARINA  ELIGIBLE RECREATIONAL TRANSIENT BOATERS WILL HAVE 12 SLIPS  2 25FTX80FT, 2 25FT X70FT, 4 19FTX38FT, AND 4 14FTX30FT , 120 LINEAR FEET OF BROADSIDE TIE UP DOCK, 30 AND 50 AMP ELECTRICAL PEDESTALS, NEW PILING AND ACCESSIBLE ALUMINUM GANGWAY FOR THEM TO USE WHILE ENJOYING OLD TOWN BANDON AND THE MANY AREA ATTRACTIONS AND SERVICES
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AWARD IS TO PROVIDE ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT TO THE BOATING INFRASTRUCTURE GRANT PROGRAM IN SOUTH CAROLINA.
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AWARD IS TO DEVELOP TRANSIENT BOATER INFRASTRUCTURE AT FORT MCALLISTER MARINA INCLUDING ONE (1) 200' X 8' FLOATING DOCK AND ASSOCIATED UTILITIES.

TRANSIENT DOCKS TO ACCOMMODATE 30 BOATS WITH POWER AND WATER WILL BE CONSTRUCTED AS PART OF ARENOVATION OF AN EXISTING BUT DILAPIDATED COMMERCIAL FACILITY ON THE SOUTH BANK OF TURNER'S CREEK TEN MILES BY LAND TO THECITY OF SAVANNAH, GEORGIA.

THE AVILA PIER AND ITS LANDING ARE PUBLIC FACILITIES IN AVILA BEACH AND ARE THE PRIMARY MEANS FOR EMBARKING AND DISEMBARKING FOR TRANSIENT BOATERS USING THE MAIN ANCHORAGE AREA NEXT TO PIER. THEY ARE OWNED AND OPERATED BY THE PORT SAN LUIS HARBOR DISTRICT.IN JUNE 2015 THE PIER WAS CLOSED TO THE PUBLIC DUE TO WEAR FROM AGE AND STORM DAMAGE. IN FEBRUARY 2019, THE TRANSIENT BOAT LANDING ON THE END WAS SIGNIFICANTLY DAMAGED AND IS CURRENTLY UNUSABLE.THE HARBOR DISTRICT WILL USE BIG TIER 1 FUNDING TO RESTORE SAFE PUBLIC ACCESS TO THE ENTIRE PIER AS WELL AS THE BOATING LANDING AT THE END OF THE PIER. IN THE EVENT OF BEING AWARDED BIG TIER 11 FUNDS, THE TIER 1 FUNDS WILL BE PUT TOWARD THE DEMOLITION OF THE OLD LANDING AND THE REHABILITATION OF THE PIER. OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT INCLUDE THE RESTORATION (OR DEMOLITION) OF THE EXISTING LANDING, REPLACEMENT AND/OR REPAIR OF DAMAGED PILES; THE REPLACEMENT OF DECKING, CAPS, AND STRINGERS; THE CREATION OF AN ADA ACCESSIBLE CORRIDOR ALONG THE LENGTH OF THE PIER. SPECIFIC COMPONENTS OF THE PROJECT ARE SUMMARIZED BELOW:TRANSIENT USE COMPONENTS:BOAT LANDING REPAIR - REPAIR OF EXISTING LANDING AT THE END OF THE PIER TO RESTORE TRANSIENT BOATER ACCESS. THIS WILL BECOME THE FIRST AND ONLY PLACE IN THE ENTIRE HARBOR (INCLUDING PORT SAN LUIS) WHERE TRANSIENT BOATERS CAN DIRECTLY BOARD WITHOUT A LADDER, TREMENDOUSLY IMPROVING ACCESS ON AND OFF THE PIER. WITH TIER II FUNDING, TIER I GRANT FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR THE DEMOLITION OF THE OLD LANDING AND TOWARD PIER REHABILITATION.PIER REHABILITATION - REPLACEMENT OF PILES, DECKING, AND OTHER WOOD COMPONENTS AND HARDWARE AS NECESSARY TO RESTORE THE LOAD CAPACITY OF THE ENTIRE PIER FOR FULL PUBLIC ACCESS. THE DECKING OF THE PIER IS NOT UP TO ADA STANDARDS. THERE ARE SIZABLE GAPS BETWEEN DECK BOARDS, SOMETIMES OVER 2 INCHES. WITH TIER 1 FUNDING, THE HARBOR DISTRICT WILL CREATE AN ACCESSIBLE CORRIDOR AT LEAST 5 FEET IN WIDTH ALONG THE LENGTH OF THE PIER BY FILLING THE GAPS BETWEEN DECKING.

THE PORT OF PORT TOWNSEND WILL USE THIS GRANT TO REPLACE THE LINEAR DOCK WITHIN THE RECREATIONAL BASIN AT ITS BOAT HAVEN FACILITY. CONSTRUCTED IN THE 1967, THE 1,035-FOOT LINEAR DOCK IS NEARING THE END OF ITS USEFUL LIFE. THIS PROJECT WILL ENSURE THAT MOORAGE FACILITIES FOR ELIGIBLE CLASS VESSELS (I.E., TRANSIENT, RECREATIONAL, NON-TRAILERABLE VESSELS OF 26 FEET OR GREATER IN LENGTH) REMAIN AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AT ONE OF THE MOST POPULAR AND BEAUTIFUL BOATING DESTINATIONS IN WASHINGTON STATE.THE BOAT HAVEN MARINA IS A FULL-SERVICE MARINA LOCATED ON THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE OLYMPIC PENINSULA IN HISTORIC PORT TOWNSEND. THE MARINA LIES ON THE PRIMARY WATER ROUTE TO THE SAN JUAN ISLANDS, A WORLD-RENOWNED BOATING DESTINATION. BOAT HAVEN, LOCATED IN THE HISTORIC TOWN OF PORT TOWNSEND, IS ALSO A DESTINATION OF CHOICE FOR RECREATIONAL BOATERS. PORT TOWNSEND IS A NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK DISTRICT AND ONE OF ONLY THREE VICTORIAN SEAPORTS IN THE UNITED STATES. IT IS HOME TO NUMEROUS ANNUAL MUSICAL FESTIVALS, AN ANNUAL FILM FESTIVAL, AND THE LARGEST WOODEN BOAT FESTIVAL IN NORTH AMERICA.PORT TOWNSEND BOAT HAVEN IS ONE OF ONLY THREE FACILITIES PROVIDING TRANSIENT RECREATIONAL BOATING MOORAGE FOR ELIGIBLE-CLASS VESSELS ON ADMIRALTY INLET, NORTH PUGET SOUND (THE OTHER SUCH FACILITY IS THE PORT'S POINT HUDSON MARINA, APPROXIMATELY 2 MILES TO THE EAST). THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL PROVIDE 26 TRANSIENT PUBLIC RECREATIONAL SLIPS AT A KEY LOCATION ON THE INLAND WATERS OF WASHINGTON STATE.

THIS GRANT WILL BE USED TO REPLACE A DOCK STRING FOR TRANSIENT RECREATIONAL MOORAGE AT THE MASON'S RESORT MARINA. THE NEW DOCKS WILL BE EQUIPPED TO SAFELY AND SECURELY HOLD BIG-ELIGIBLE VESSELS. THE MARINA HAS BATHROOMS, CAMPING, AND MOTEL ACCOMMODATIONS,AS WELL AS STORE AND CAFE ACCESS, ALL WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE OF THE MOORAGE.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO HELP FUND BOATING IMPROVEMENTS AT APACHE LAKE. THEPROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT SEVEN TRANSIENT BOAT SLIPS AT APACHE LAKE FOR VESSELS 26 FEET ANDLONGER. THE REPLACEMENT OF THE EXISTING FUEL DOCK AND FUEL PUMPS AT APACHE LAKE WILLALLOW BOATERS TO RECREATE WITHOUT HAVING TO LEAVE THE LAKE TO REFUEL. THIS PROJECT WILL BECOMPLETED BY A SUB-GRANTEE, APACHE LAKE MARINA. THESE IMPROVEMENTS ARE INTENDED TO BEUTILIZED BY VESSELS 26 FEET AND LONGER. AN INCREASE IN BOAT USE DAYS FOR VESSELS OVER 26 FTWILL BE REALIZED WITH THESE IMPROVEMENTS.

THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THIS BOATING INFRASTRUCTURE GANT - TIER II IS TO INSTALL 20 DESIGNATED TRANSIENT FLOATING SLIPS (INCLUDE IN-SLIP WATER/ELECTRICAL), UPGRADE MARINE FUELING STATION, RENOVATE BATHROOM FACILITIES TO ADA STANDARDS, AND INSTALL "NO WAKE" BUOY'S AROUND RIVER'S REST MARINA TO REDUCE THE IMPACT OF WAVE ENERGY UPON THE INFRASTRUCTURE AND TO PROTECT FROM SHORELINE EROSION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE DESIGN AND ENGINEERING FOR THE NEW FLOATING SLIPS, FUEL SYSTEM, AND BATHHOUSE. SECURE BIDS AND SELECT CONTRACTORS TO PERFORM THE WORK. EXECUTE AGREEMENTS AMONGST THE INDIVIDUAL CONTRACTORS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH; SUB-RECIPIENT AGREEMENT. THE INTENDED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASING THE NUMBER OF TRANSIENT SLIPS ON THE CHICKAHOMINY RIVER, PROVIDE TRANSIENT BOATERS AN OPPORTUNITY TO NAVIGATE A NATURAL DEEP-WATER TRIBUTARY OF THE JAMES RIVER AND ACCESS TO FUEL, ADA COMPLIANT BATHHOUSE, SWIMMING POOL, AND RESTAURANT. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE TRANSIENT BOATERS, CHARLES CITY COUNTY WITH THE INCREASED TAX REVENUE, AND OTHER BOATERS SEEKING TO PURCHASE FUEL AND HAVE ACCESS TO ADA COMPLIANT FACILITIES.

THE CITY OF REDONDO BEACH (CITY) OPERATES AND MAINTAINS KING HARBOR, LOCATED IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY.THE HARBOR IS A MAJOR DESTINATION FOR TOURISM, SPORT FISHING, AND RECREATIONAL BOATING IN THE SOUTHERNCALIFORNIA AREA. IT ALSO OFFERS SEVERAL AMENITIES FOR BOATERS INCLUDING TWO PUBLIC SEWAGE PUMP OUTSTATIONS. ONE OF THE STATIONS IS ON A DEDICATED DOCK AND THE OTHER IS LOCATED DIRECTLY ADJACENT ON ASHARED DOCK WITHIN THE CITY HARBOR PATROL FACILITIES. BOTH FACILITIES ARE APPROACHING THE END OF THEIR USEFULLIFE. DUE TO EXTENSIVE DAMAGE THERE IS CONCERN THAT THE DEFICIENCIES IDENTIFIED COULD RESULT IN OPERATIONALUSE LIMITATIONS, POSE A RISK TO SAFETY, AND INCREASE ONGOING MAINTENANCE COST. THIS PROJECT WILL EXTENDTHE USEFUL LIFE OF THE FACILITIES FOR AN ADDITIONAL 30-PLUS YEARS.THE EXISTING PUBLIC PUMP OUT FACILITY IS LOCATED IN THE KING HARBOR MAIN ENTRANCE CHANNEL ON THE OUTSIDEOF A CONCRETE SHEET PILE BREAKWATER AND CONSISTS OF A CONCRETE FLOATING DOCK SYSTEM (400 SF), SUPPORTEDBY TWO (2) ROUND CONCRETE GUIDE PILES APPROXIMATELY EIGHTEEN {18) INCHES IN DIAMETER, WHICH PROVIDESMOORING FOR ONE (1) VESSEL UP-TO 45-FEET IN LENGTH. THE SECOND EXISTING PUMP OUT, IS LOCATED JUST ON THEINSIDE OF THE BREAKWATER WITHIN THE HARBOR PATROL FACILITY, WHICH CAN ALSO ACCOMMODATE ONE (1) VESSELUP-TO 45-FEET IN LENGTH. IT IS PROPOSED TO MOVE ALL PUMP OUT OPERATIONS TO A NEW FACILITY IN THE SAMELOCATION AS THE EXISTING DOCK ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE BREAKWATER IN THE MAIN ENTRANCE CHANNEL.THE NEW PUMP OUT DOCK WILL ALLOW FOR USE OF MULTIPLE TRANSIENT RECREATIONAL VESSELS AT ONE TIME, AS WELLAS INCREASE THE ALLOWABLE VESSEL SIZE UP-TO 100-FEET IN LENGTH. ACCORDING TO INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THECITY HARBOR PATROL, IT IS NOT UNCOMMON FOR BOTH OF THE EXISTING PUMP OUT STATIONS TO BE IN USE AT THESAME TIME AND TO HAVE OTHER VESSELS CIRCLING IN A QUEUE WAITING TO USE THE PUMP OUT FACILITIES. THE CITYWOULD LIKE TO ALLEVIATE ISSUES WITH BOATERS POTENTIALLY DUMPING WASTE INTO THE HARBOR, WHICH HAS ALSOCOMMONLY OCCURRED IN THE PAST. IN ADDITION, IT IS OFTEN THAT ONE PUMP OUT IS TAKEN OFFLINE DUE TOMAINTENANCE OR MALFUNCTION AND THE ABILITY TO HAVE TWO PUMP OUTS ADDS REDUNDANCY TO THE SYSTEM. THUS, IT IS NECESSARY TO PROVIDE TWO NEW PUMP OUT STANCHIONS.THE NEW DOCK WILL BE WIDER TO CREATE A MORE STABLE WALKING SURFACE. THE PROPOSED FACILITY IS LOCATED INTHE MAIN CHANNEL OF THE MARINA AND IS AFFECTED BY THE WAKE OF OTHER VESSELS. ENGINEERING STUDIES HAVESHOWN THAT A WIDER AND LONGER DOCK IS NEEDED TO PROVIDE A FACILITY THAT IS DESIRABLE BY TRANSIENTRECREATIONAL VESSELS. PROVIDING A 100-FT LONG BERTH ALLOWS MULTIPLE VESSELS SIMULTANEOUSLY. THE 100-FTBERTH IS REQUIRED TO PROVIDE SAFETY FOR LARGER VESSELS TO TIE UP WHEN USING A PUMP OUT, ESPECIALLY DURINGSTORMY CONDITIONS. THE DOCK WILL ALSO HAVE POTABLE WATER FIXTURES FOR USE BY RECREATIONAL BOATERS ANDMAINTENANCE PERSONNEL. THE PROPOSED FACILITY CONSISTS OF A CONCRETE FLOATING DOCK SYSTEM (1,200 SF),SUPPORTED BY FIVE (5) NEW ROUND CONCRETE GUIDE PILES APPROXIMATELY TWENTY-FOUR (24) INCHES IN DIAMETERAND WILL BE DESIGNED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE LATEST EDITION OF THE CALIFORNIA BUILDING CODE. CONSTRUCTION ISANTICIPATED TO START AROUND THE 3RD QUARTER OF 2021 AND TO BE COMPLETED BY 2ND QUARTER OF 2022.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS EXECUTE THE FINAL DESIGN, PERMITTING, AND CONSTRUCTION OF A WAVE ATTENUATION STRUCTURE AT THE YACHT CLUB MARINA AT PALMAS DEL MAR TO PROVIDE TRANQUIL BERTHING CONDITIONS. THE WAVE ATTENUATION STRUCTURE WILL INCLUDE PANELING ALONG DOCK D (575 FT.) DOWN TO THE SEABED AS WELL AS A SPUR/CHANNEL EXTENSION FEATURE (75 FT.) THAT WILL CONSIST OF PANELING AND A ROCK REVETMENT LEADING TO DOCK D (65 FT.)
